column4: hi i would like to ask, how is it possible that a drive gets formatted when you tell the partitioner to resize?
It shouldn't get "reformatted" if you just tell it to resize, it will however re-write the partition table, but that is not reformatting
Yikes, you might try "testdisk", but if the partition really was formatted over then most if not all your data is gone :(
Firstly, what makes you think that your windows partition is gone?
the windows one is there, its the fat32 that i used to backup all my files that is gone
What makes you think that it is gone?
Testdisk is available through synaptic/ apt on Ubuntu BTW, in case you don't know how to install software yet.
Can you pastebin the output of "sudo fdisk -l" ?
If you install testdisk from the liveCD you will need to enable the universe repository first
testdisk is available for both, but 7.10 will have a newer version
i cant get online with that machine. can i install it using a different source?
Yes, you can download the .deb before hand and put it on a USB drive or something
can i somehow get it off the 7.10 cd? i dont have a pen drive

Testdisk does not come on the Ubuntu LiveCD, you will need to download it separately or connect to the internet from  the LiveCD ( or use a data recovery distribution that has it installed on the CD itself ).
can i somehow use the 7.10 applications cd? i though i can use that as a repo?

It is only a repository for the default applications, and the DVD only contains the main repository, testdisk is in universe ( I think it would take at least 6 DVD's full of compressed packages to hold all of the packages in universe )
